Posts.Content: atillybilly wrote: About a month ago I noticed aÂ change in my left breast, a dimple that really shows when you lean forward, hands on hips and contract chest muscles. I am 27 y/o and have very dense breasts (not necessarily due to God's grace as it is to the delicious foods he helped us create lol) and cannot feel any lumps or bumps. I have had pain in my breasts here and there but neverreally paid much attention to it (don't usually get period due to birth control). After calling 2x a week since the day I saw the dimple I finally got into my Dr last week, she came into the room and asked me what the problem was...I assumed the position and from across the room (about 4-5 ft away) she could see the dimple. Due to my age they have ordered a breast u/s, and I think it is only of the affected breast. If they find nothing on this U/S should I leave it at that or should I also ask for a mammo or something else? I am going in tomorrow morning and would like to know what I should ask for etc before I go there. My grandmother had breast cancer (not hereditary) before she died (not of the cancer though). Also I have been exposed to a lot of radiation (Graves disease so I had a radioactive uptake and scan along with a radioactive Idonine abalation, not to mention normal xrays etc). Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Wish me luck...u/s tomorrow and worried atillybilly atillybilly
Wish me luck...u/s tomorrow and worried atillybilly atillybilly

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2012 08:06PM atillybilly wrote: Thank you all for the advice...they did order a mammo but because of my age and density radiology changed it already to u/s....I know if I was at my last hospital, where I knew all the staff, the tech and radiologist that i wouldnt be concerned....just scary when you lose control...now I know even more how our patients felt (worked on hem/onc for two years in San Diego.and the ambulatory infusion center...before I went to my last command) I was so young I didn't realize how much trust they had in us doing who we did....even WHEN (power of positive thinking) turns out to be nothing I cannot forget how this experience has changed me and made me really thInk
